org.settings4j

Interface Settings4jInstance

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultSettings

    public interface Settings4jInstance
    SettingsInstance is used to get simply access to Application settings.
    Author:
    Harald.Brabenetz
    See Also:
    Settings4j

    • Method Detail

      • getString

        String getString(String key)
        return the found String-Value for the given key.
        The Settings4jInstance Instance iterates all his Connectors and return the first found Value.

        Returns null if no connector found a Value for the given key

        Parameters:
        key - the Key for the configuration-property. e.g.: "com/mycompany/myapp/myParameterKey"
        Returns:
        the found String-Value for the given key

      • getContent

        byte[] getContent(String key)
        return the found byte[]-Value for the given key.
        The Settings4jInstance Instance iterates all his Connectors and return the first found Value.

        Returns null if no connector found a Value for the given key

        Parameters:
        key - the Key for the configuration-property. e.g.: "com/mycompany/myapp/myParameterKey"
        Returns:
        the found byte[]-Value for the given key

      • getObject

        Object getObject(String key)
        return the found Object-Value for the given key.
        The Settings4jInstance iterates all his Connectors and return the first found Value.
        Returns null if no connector found a Value for the given key
        Parameters:
        key - the Key for the configuration-property. e.g.: "com/mycompany/myapp/myParameterKey"
        Returns:
        the found Object-Value for the given key

      • addConnector

        void addConnector(Connector connector)
        Add a Connector.

        This method will be call, if you create a connector-ref to a connector configuration in your settings4j.xml 

         Example configuration in settings4j.xml:
 --------------------------------------
 <settings name="com.mycompany" >
     <connector-ref name="DBConnector" />
 </settings>
 --------------------------------------
        Parameters:
        connector - The connector to add.

      • addConnector

        void addConnector(Connector connector,
                  ConnectorPosition position)
        Add a custom Connector to the right position in relation to the other connectors.

        This method can be used to add custom connectors into the Settings4jInstance

        Example usage 1:

         --------------------------------------
 Connector myConnector = ...
 addConnector(myConnector, ConnectorPositions.afterLast(SystemPropertyConnector.class));
 --------------------------------------

        Example usage 2:

        ConnectorPositions.afterLast(SystemPropertyConnector.class) will throw an exception if the Settings4jInstance doesn't have a SystemPropertyConnector.
        To prevent an Exception you can provide multiple ConnectorPositions as fallback: 

         --------------------------------------
 Connector myConnector = ...
 addConnector(myConnector, ConnectorPositions.firstValid(//
     ConnectorPositions.afterLast(SystemPropertyConnector.class),
     ConnectorPositions.atFirst() // fallback if no SystemPropertyConnector exists.
   )
 );
 --------------------------------------

        Example usage 3:

        addConnector(Connector) will throw an exception if a connector with the same name already exists.
        To prevent this Exception you should also check with getConnector(String) if the Connector already exists: 

         --------------------------------------
 Connector myConnector = ...
 if(getConnector(myConnector.getName()) == null) {
   addConnector(myConnector, ConnectorPositions.firstValid(//
       ConnectorPositions.afterLast(SystemPropertyConnector.class),
       ConnectorPositions.atFirst() // fallback if no SystemPropertyConnector exists.
     )
   );
 }
 --------------------------------------
        Parameters:
        connector - The connector to add.
        position - The position where the connector should be added.

      • removeAllConnectors

        void removeAllConnectors()
        Remove all Settings. (Internal use only)

      • getMapping

        Map<String,String> getMapping()
        The key mapping defined in settings4j.xml.

        if some Sub-Modules of your App defines separated Keys for e.g. the DataSource, you can refer it to one unique Key: 

         Example:
 <mapping name="defaultMapping">
     <entry key="com/mycompany/moduleX/datasource" ref-key="global/datasource"/>
     <entry key="com/mycompany/moduleY/datasource" ref-key="global/datasource"/>
 </mapping>

        Settings4j.getXXX("com/mycompany/moduleX/datasource");
        should return the configured value under "global/datasource"

        Returns:
        the Mappings of this Settings-Object (without inheritances)

      • setMapping

        void setMapping(Map<String,String> mapping)
        Set the mapping for this Settings-Object without inheritance.

        This method will be call, if you create a mapping-ref to a mapping configuration in your settings4j.xml 

         Example:
 <root mapping-ref="defaultMapping" >
    ...
 </root>

 <mapping name="defaultMapping">
     <entry key="com/mycompany/moduleX/datasource" ref-key="global/datasource"/>
     <entry key="com/mycompany/moduleY/datasource" ref-key="global/datasource"/>
 </mapping>
        Parameters:
        mapping - The Mapping between available settings to used settings.

      • getConnectors

        List<Connector> getConnectors()
        Return a List off Connector who can be used with this Settings4jInstance instance.
        Returns:
        a list off all Connectors who can be used with this Settings4jInstance instance

      • getConnector

        Connector getConnector(String connectorName)
        Return the Connector for the given Name.
        Parameters:
        connectorName - The Connector Name.
        Returns:
        The Connector for the given Name.
